p:
In the second part of the Doust and Lyon experiment,
3 it was concluded that face masks made of coarse or medium gauze from two to ten layers did not prevent the projection of inhaled material during coughing and that “such masks are worthless, therefore, in preventing the dissemination of respiratory infections”. However, “three-layer butter cloth masks were effective and should be worn in connection with respiratory diseases”. This is the genesis of the use of face masks to prevent the transmission of infective droplets, carried out at the time of the Spanish flu pandemic.
